summary.purpose: Utility for formatting Israeli vehicle license plate numbers with standard dashes based on plate length.
summary.problem_solved: Normalizes vehicle license plate display across the application by applying correct formatting conventions for Israeli plates (5-8 characters) with appropriate dash placement for readability.

exports.name: formatCarNumber
exports.description_one_line: Formats vehicle license plate with dashes based on Israeli license plate standards.

symbols.name: formatCarNumber
symbols.description_one_line: Adds dashes to Israeli license plate based on length using standard formatting rules.

returns.description: Formatted license plate with dashes, or original string if length is not 5-8

details.what_it_does: Uses a switch statement on string length to format Israeli license plates: 8 chars → 'XXX-XX-XXX', 7 chars → 'XX-XXX-XX', 6 chars → 'XX-XX-XX', 5 chars → 'X-XX-XX'. Returns input unchanged if length doesn't match these patterns.
behavior_notes: Handles null/undefined gracefully: returns original value if falsy
8-character plates: format as 3-2-3 (most common for modern Israeli vehicles)
Returns unformatted input for unusual lengths (4 chars, 9+ chars)

minimal_correct.title: Format Israeli license plates
minimal_correct.code:
import { formatCarNumber } from './cars';

formatCarNumber('12345678');  // '123-45-678'
formatCarNumber('1234567');   // '12-345-67'
formatCarNumber('123456');    // '12-34-56'
formatCarNumber('12345');     // '1-23-45'

extensive.title: Using with vehicle data in table

incorrect_pattern.title: Common mistake: Assuming all plates are 8 characters
